00037 // Set of partition dataflow analyses that were split in a given call to split.
00038 // The original analysis that was split is explicitly identified as the "master" of the split.
00039 class partSplit
00040 {
00041         public:
00042         std::set<IntraPartitionDataflow*> splitSet;
00043         IntraPartitionDataflow* master;
00044         
00045         partSplit(IntraPartitionDataflow* master)
00046         {
00047                 this->master = master;
00048                 splitSet.insert(master);
00049         }
00050         
00051         void addChild(IntraPartitionDataflow* child)
00052         {
00053                 splitSet.insert(child);
00054         }
00055         
00056         std::string str(std::string indent="")
00057         {
00058           std::ostringstream oss;
00059                 
00060                 oss << indent << "[partSplit:\n";
00061                 oss << indent << "    splitSet = <";
00062                 for(std::set<IntraPartitionDataflow*>::iterator it=splitSet.begin(); it!=splitSet.end(); )
00063                 {
00064                         oss << (*it);
00065                         it++;
00066                         if(it!=splitSet.end()) oss << ", ";
00067                 }
00068                 oss << ">\n";
00069                 oss << indent << "    master = "<< master << "]\n";
00070 
00071                 return oss.str();
00072         }
00073 };
00074 
00075 class PartitionedAnalysis : virtual public IntraProceduralAnalysis
00076 {
00077         // the partitions that are currently executing
00078         std::set<IntraPartitionDataflow*> activeParts;
00079         // the set of partitions that are currently blocked and need to be explicitly
00080         // unblocked before they may resume execution
00081         //std::set<IntraPartitionDataflow*> blockedParts;
00082         // the set of partitions that have called join and are simply waiting to be joined
00083         // to the master partitions that they split from
00084         std::set<IntraPartitionDataflow*> joinParts;
00085         
00086         // Maps partitions to their respective splits. A given partition may be split
00087         // multiple times in a hierarchical fashion (split-join). The first split
00088         // in the list corresponds to the outer-most split and the last split
00089         // is the inner-most split. Thus, if a given partition performs a join,
00090         // the jointed split is the last/inner-most split in parts2splits.
00091         std::map<IntraPartitionDataflow*, std::list<partSplit*> > parts2splits;
00092         
00093         // Maps analysis partitions to their respective current execution states
00094         // (these are only upto-date for analyses that are currently stopped)
00095         std::map<IntraPartitionDataflow*, IntraPartitionDataflowCheckpoint*> parts2chkpts;
00096         
00097         // Sample interprocedural analysis object that we'll use as a factory to create more such objects
00098         IntraPartitionDataflow* intraFactory;
00099         
00100         public:
00101         // Creates a PartitionedAnalysis, starting the analysis with the given
00102         // master analysis partition and creating an initial split that only contains the master.
00103         PartitionedAnalysis(IntraPartitionDataflow* intraFactory);
00104         
00105         // Create the initial partition state for analyzing some function
00106         void initMaster();
00107         
00108         // Returns a reference to the master dataflow analysis. At the end of the partitioned analysis,
00109         // it is this object that owns all the dataflow state generated by the overall analysis.
00110         IntraPartitionDataflow* getMasterDFAnalysis();
00111         
00112         // Activates the given partition, returning true if it was previously inactive and false otherwise.
00113         bool activatePart(IntraPartitionDataflow* part);
00114         
00115         // Splits the given dataflow analysis partition into several partitions, one for each given checkpoint
00116         // The partition origA will be assigned the last checkpoint in partitionChkpts.
00117         // If newSplit==true, this split operation creates a new split within origA's current split and place
00118         //    the newly-generated partitions into this split. 
00119         // If newSplit==false, the newly-generated partitions will be added to origA's current split.
00120         // If newPartActive==true, the newly-generated partitions will be made initially active. If not,
00121         //    they will start out in joined status.
00122         // Returns the set of newly-created partitions.
00123         std::set<IntraPartitionDataflow*> split(IntraPartitionDataflow* origA, std::vector<IntraPartitionDataflowCheckpoint*> partitionChkpts,
00124                                            const Function& func, NodeState* fState, bool newSplit, bool newPartActive);
00125         
00126         // Joins all the analysis partitions in a given split into a single partition, unioning
00127         // their respective dataflow information
00128         void join(IntraPartitionDataflow* joinA, IntraPartitionDataflowCheckpoint* chkpt,
00129                   const Function& func, NodeState* fState);
00130         
00131         // Called by the base PartitionedAnalysis class when all partitions in a given split have decided 
00132         //    to join to decide whether they should be joined or all released. It may also do some 
00133         //    processing of their state prior to the release or join.
00134         // Returns the set of partitions that will remain in joined status after this join. If all partitions in the split
00135         //    set are on this list, they are all joined(all but one will be deleted). Any remaining partitions will be released.
00136         virtual std::set<IntraPartitionDataflow*> preJoin(partSplit* s, const Function& func, NodeState* fState,
00137                                                      const std::map<IntraPartitionDataflow*, 
00138                                                      IntraPartitionDataflowCheckpoint*>& parts2chkpts)=0;
00139         
00140         // Called by the base PartitionedAnalysis class when all partitions in a given split have 
00141         //    finished their respective executions.
00142         virtual void postFinish(partSplit* s, 
00143                                 const std::map<IntraPartitionDataflow*, IntraPartitionDataflowCheckpoint*>& parts2chkpts)=0;
00144         
00145         // runs the intra-procedural analysis on the given function, returns true if 
00146         // the function's NodeState gets modified as a result and false otherwise
00147         // state - the function's NodeState
00148         bool runAnalysis(const Function& func, NodeState* state);
00149 };

00151 // Given a source analysis, splits the dataflow states of all the CFG nodes in
00152 // a given function so that the target analysis gets copies of the source analysis'
00153 // state.
00154 class partitionDFAnalysisState: virtual public UnstructuredPassIntraAnalysis
00155 {
00156         Analysis* srcAnalysis;
00157         Analysis* tgtAnalysis;
00158         
00159         public:
00160         partitionDFAnalysisState(Analysis* srcAnalysis, Analysis* tgtAnalysis)
00161         {
00162                 this->srcAnalysis = srcAnalysis;
00163                 this->tgtAnalysis = tgtAnalysis;
00164         }
00165         
00166         void visit(const Function& func, const DataflowNode& n, NodeState& state)
00167         {
00168                 state.cloneAnalysisState(srcAnalysis, tgtAnalysis);
00169         }
00170 };

00172 // Given a set of analyses, one of which is designated as a master, unions together the 
00173 // dataflow states associated on each CFG node with each of these analyses.
00174 // The results are associated on each CFG node with the master analysis.
00175 class unionDFAnalysisStatePartitions: virtual public UnstructuredPassIntraAnalysis
00176 {
00177         std::set<Analysis*> unionSet;
00178         Analysis* master;
00179         
00180         public:
00181         unionDFAnalysisStatePartitions(
00182                 std::set<Analysis*>& unionSet, Analysis* master)
00183         {
00184                 for(std::set<Analysis*>::iterator it = unionSet.begin(); it!=unionSet.end(); it++)
00185                 { this->unionSet.insert(*it); }
00186                 //this->unionSet = unionSet;
00187                 this->master = master;
00188         }
00189         
00190         void visit(const Function& func, const DataflowNode& n, NodeState& state);
00191 };

00193 // Deletes all the state associated with the given analyses
00194 class deleteDFAnalysisState: virtual public UnstructuredPassIntraAnalysis
00195 {
00196         std::set<IntraPartitionDataflow*> tgtA;
00197         
00198         public:
00199         deleteDFAnalysisState(std::set<IntraPartitionDataflow*>& tgtA)
00200         {
00201                 this->tgtA = tgtA;
00202         }
00203         
00204         void visit(const Function& func, const DataflowNode& n, NodeState& state)
00205         {
00206                 for(std::set<IntraPartitionDataflow*>::iterator it = tgtA.begin(); it!=tgtA.end(); it++)
00207                         state.deleteState((Analysis*)*it);
00208         }
00209 };

00212 class IntraPartitionDataflow : virtual public IntraProceduralDataflow
00213 {
00214         protected:
00215         PartitionedAnalysis* parent;
00216         
00217         public:
00218         // The logic expression that describes the invariant that holds for this partition      
00219         /*LogicalCond*/printable* partitionCond;
00220         
00221         IntraPartitionDataflow(const IntraPartitionDataflow& that)
00222         {
00223                 parent = that.parent;
00224                 partitionCond = that.partitionCond;
00225         }
00226         
00227         IntraPartitionDataflow(PartitionedAnalysis* parent)
00228         {
00229                 this->parent = parent;
00230                 partitionCond = NULL;
00231         }
00232         
00233         ~IntraPartitionDataflow()
00234         {
00235                 delete partitionCond;
00236         }

00240                 parent = NULL;
00241         }

00243         void setParent(PartitionedAnalysis* parent)
00244         {
00245                 this->parent = parent;  
00246         }*/
00247         
00248         PartitionedAnalysis* getParent() const
00249         {
00250                 return parent;  
00251         }
00252         
00253         // A dummy analysis that is associated with facts connected with the 
00254         // IntraPartitionDataflow-specific logic rather than the logic of a class that 
00255         // derives from IntraPartitionDataflow.
00256         // Analysis* dummy;
00257         
00258         // Creates a new instance of the derived object that is a copy of the original instance.
00259         // This instance will be used to instantiate a new partition of the analysis.
00260         virtual IntraPartitionDataflow* copy()=0;
00261         
00262         virtual bool runAnalysis(const Function& func, NodeState* fState, bool& splitPart, 
00263                                       bool &joinPart, IntraPartitionDataflowCheckpoint*& outChkpt)=0;
00264         
00265         // Resumes the execution of runAnalysis from the given checkpoint
00266         // splitPart - set by the call to indicate that it exited because it was split
00267         // joinPart - set by the call to indicate that it exited because it wishes to join the partitions that it split from
00268         // outChkpt - set by the call to be the checkpoint that representing the state of this analysis at the time of the exit
00269         //            set to NULL in the case of a normal exit or a split exit
00270         virtual bool runAnalysisResume(const Function& func, NodeState* fState, 
00271                                IntraPartitionDataflowCheckpoint* chkpt, bool& splitPart, 
00272                                bool &joinPart, IntraPartitionDataflowCheckpoint*& outChkpt)=0;
00273         
00274         // Called when a partition is created to allow a specific analysis to initialize
00275         // its dataflow information from the partition condition
00276         virtual void initDFfromPartCond(const Function& func, const DataflowNode& n, NodeState& state, 
00277                                         const std::vector<Lattice*>& dfInfo, const std::vector<NodeFact*>& facts,
00278                                         /*LogicalCond*/printable* partitionCond) {}
00279 };
00280 
00281 class IntraPartitionDataflowCheckpoint
00282 {
00283         public: 
00284         // A checkpoint of the dataflow state associated with the given state of the dataflow analysis
00285         dataflow::checkpoint dfChkpt;
00286         // Set of nodes that this analysis has blocked progress on until the next join point
00287         std::set<DataflowNode>    joinNodes;
00288         // The DataflowNode that that analysis was processing when the checkpoint was taken
00289         DataflowNode*        curNode;
00290         // The logical condition that is an invariant of all the states of the dataflow analysis
00291         /*LogicalCond*/printable*         partitionCond;
00292         // Given that the current node in the dataflow analysis has one or more successors, the index of 
00293         // the given node's successor
00294         int                  partitionIndex;
00295         
00296         // the arguments to runAnalysis() used as part of the dataflow pass
00297         const Function& func;
00298         NodeState* fState;
00299         
00300         IntraPartitionDataflowCheckpoint(IntraPartitionDataflowCheckpoint &that): 
00301                 dfChkpt(that.dfChkpt), func(that.func)
00302         {
00303                 this->joinNodes      = that.joinNodes;
00304                 if(that.curNode)
00305                         this->curNode     = new DataflowNode(*(that.curNode));
00306                 else
00307                         this->curNode     = NULL;
00308                 
00309                 this->partitionCond  = that.partitionCond;
00310                 this->partitionIndex = that.partitionIndex;
00311                 this->fState         = that.fState;
00312         }
00313         
00314         IntraPartitionDataflowCheckpoint(dataflow::checkpoint& dfChkpt, const std::set<DataflowNode>& joinNodes, 
00315                                          const DataflowNode* curNode,
00316                                          /*LogicalCond*/printable* partitionCond, int partitionIndex, 
00317                                          const Function& func, NodeState* fState) : 
00318                 dfChkpt(dfChkpt), func(func)
00319         {
00320                 this->joinNodes      = joinNodes;
00321                 if(curNode)
00322                         this->curNode     = new DataflowNode(*curNode);
00323                 else
00324                         this->curNode     = NULL;
00325                 
00326                 this->partitionCond  = partitionCond;
00327                 this->partitionIndex = partitionIndex;
00328                 this->fState         = fState;
00329         }
00330         
00331         ~IntraPartitionDataflowCheckpoint()
00332         {
00333                 //delete partitionCond;
00334                 if(curNode)
00335                         delete curNode;
00336         }
00337         
00338         std::string str(std::string indent="")
00339         {
00340           std::ostringstream outs;
00341                 outs << indent << "[IntraPartitionDataflowCheckpoint : \n"; //fflush(stdout);
00342                 outs << indent << "    dfChkpt = \n"<<dfChkpt.str(indent+"    ")<<"\n";
00343                 if(curNode)
00344                         outs << indent << "    curNode = <"<<curNode->getNode()->class_name()<<" | "<<curNode->getNode()->unparseToString()<<" | "<< curNode->getIndex() << ">\n";
00345                 else
00346                         outs << indent << "    curNode = NULL\n";
00347                 
00348                 if(joinNodes.size()==0)
00349         outs << indent << "    joinNodes = None\n";
00350       else
00351       {
00352         outs << indent << "    joinNodes = \n";
00353                         for(std::set<DataflowNode>::iterator it=joinNodes.begin(); it!=joinNodes.end(); it++)
00354                         { outs << indent << "        <"<<(*it).getNode()->class_name()<<" | "<<(*it).getNode()->unparseToString()<<">\n"; }
00355                 }
00356                 if(partitionCond)
00357                         outs << indent << "    partitionCond = \n"<<partitionCond->str(indent+"        ")<<"\n";
00358 
00359                 if(partitionIndex>=0)
00360                         outs << indent << "    partitionIndex = descendant "<<partitionIndex<<"]";
00361                 else
00362                         outs << indent << "    partitionIndex = all descendants ("<<partitionIndex<<")]";
00363                 return outs.str();
00364         }
00365 };

00367 class IntraPartitionFWDataflow  : public virtual IntraPartitionDataflow
00368 {
00369         protected:
00370         //std::vector<<Lattice*> initState;
00371         
00372         //std::map <DataflowNode, Lattice*> nodeState;
00373         //std::map<DataflowNode, std::list<Lattice*> > nodeState;
00374         
00375         public:
00376         IntraPartitionFWDataflow(PartitionedAnalysis* parent): IntraPartitionDataflow(parent)
00377         { }
00378         
00379         IntraPartitionFWDataflow(const IntraPartitionFWDataflow& that): 
00380                         IntraPartitionDataflow((const IntraPartitionDataflow&)that)
00381         {
00382                 //this->initState = that.initState;
00383         }
00384         
00385         /*IntraPartitionFWDataflow(): IntraPartitionDataflow()
00386         { }*/
00387         
00388         // the transfer function that is applied to every node
00389         // n - the dataflow node that is being processed
00390         // state - the NodeState object that describes the state of the node, as established by earlier 
00391         //         analysis passes
00392         // dfInfo - the Lattices that this transfer function operates on. The function takes these lattices
00393         //          as input and overwrites them with the result of the transfer.
00394         // splitAnalysis - set by callee to 
00395         //    - noSplit if the analysis does not want a split
00396         //    - splitNew if the analysis wants to perform a split and place the newly-generated partitions into
00397         //      a fresh split set that is nested inside this partition's current split
00398         //    - splitParent if the analysis wants to perform a split and place the newly-generated partitions 
00399         //      into this partition's current split (i.e. on the same split level as the current partition)
00400         typedef enum {noSplit, splitNew, splitParent} splitType;
00401         // splitConditions - if splitAnalysis==splitNew or ==splitParent, the analysis sets this vector to the conditions for all the 
00402         //                   descendant CFG nodes in the split
00403         /* // joinAnalysis - set to true if the analysis wants to perform a join */
00404         // joinNode - set to true if progress along the given dataflow node needs to be blocked until the next join point.
00405         //            If all paths of dataflow progress are blocked in this analysis, this is the same as the analysis 
00406         //            requesting to be joined.
00407         // Returns true if any of the input lattices changed as a result of the transfer function and
00408         //    false otherwise.
00409         virtual bool transfer(const Function& func, const DataflowNode& n, NodeState& state, const std::vector<Lattice*>& dfInfo, 
00410                               splitType& splitAnalysis, std::vector</*LogicalCond*/printable*>& splitConditions, /*bool& joinAnalysis, */bool& joinNode)=0;
00411         
00412         // Runs the intra-procedural analysis on the given function. Returns true if 
00413         // the function's NodeState gets modified as a result and false otherwise.
00414         // state - the function's NodeState
00415         bool runAnalysis(const Function& func, NodeState* fState, bool analyzeDueToCallers, std::set<Function> calleesUpdated);
00416         
00417         // Runs the intra-procedural analysis on the given function. 
00418         // Returns true if the function's NodeState gets modified as a result and false otherwise.
00419         // state - the function's NodeState
00420         bool runAnalysis(const Function& func, NodeState* fState,
00421                          bool& splitPart, bool &joinPart, IntraPartitionDataflowCheckpoint*& outChkpt);
00422         
00423         // Resumes the execution of runAnalysis from the given checkpoint
00424         bool runAnalysisResume(const Function& func, NodeState* fState, 
00425                                IntraPartitionDataflowCheckpoint* chkpt, bool& splitPart,
00426                                bool &joinPart, IntraPartitionDataflowCheckpoint*& outChkpt);
00427         
00428         typedef enum {retFalse, cont, normal} partitionTranferRet;
00429 
00430         partitionTranferRet partitionTranfer(
00431                                    const Function& func, NodeState* fState, const DataflowNode& n, NodeState* state, VirtualCFG::dataflow& dfIt,
00432                                    const std::vector<Lattice*>& dfInfoBelow, bool& splitPart, std::set<DataflowNode>& joinNodes, 
00433                                    IntraPartitionDataflowCheckpoint*& outChkpt);
00434         
00435         // propagates the forward dataflow info from the current node's NodeState (curNodeState) to the next node's 
00436         // NodeState (nextNodeState)
00437         bool propagateFWStateToNextNode(
00438              const std::vector<Lattice*>& curNodeState, DataflowNode curDFNode, int nodeIndex,
00439              const std::vector<Lattice*>& nextNodeState, DataflowNode nextDFNode);
00440 };
